comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)
Build Identifier: 4.0

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb429629.aspx

Adds a tile layer to the map, and if the visibleOnLoad parameter is true, it also shows it on the map.

Tried the example on the webpage and the issue only happens in FF4. This is also affecting a website I have.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a map that uses VEMap.AddTileLayer to allow for a tile layer to overlay the map
2.View the map

Actual Results:  
The tile does not overlay on top of the map

Expected Results:  
The tile should have overlayed on top of the map
comments.author: rainmanjam@hotmail.com
comments.creator: rainmanjam@hotmail.com

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)
Build Identifier: 4.0

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb429629.aspx

Adds a tile layer to the map, and if the visibleOnLoad parameter is true, it also shows it on the map.

Tried the example on the webpage and the issue only happens in FF4. This is also affecting a website I have.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a map that uses VEMap.AddTileLayer to allow for a tile layer to overlay the map
2.View the map

Actual Results:  
The tile does not overlay on top of the map

Expected Results:  
The tile should have overlayed on top of the map
